info.title: Open Data API
info.description: Latest Swagger specification for OpenData Branch Locator

get.description: Gets a list of all `Branch` objects.

parameters.name: If-Modified-Since
parameters.description: Used for conditional request, to retrieve data only if modified since a given date

parameters.name: If-None-Match
parameters.description: Used for conditional request, to retrieve data only if the given Etag value does not match

200.description: Successful response with a list of `Branch` data

Etag.description: A unique ID identifying whether this resource has changed

Cache-Control.description: Describes how long this response can be cached

X-Frame-Options.description: Prevent this request from being loaded in any iframes

X-Content-Type-Options.description: Ensures each page has a content type and prevents browsers from doing MIME type sniffing

enum: Use of the APIs and any related data will be subject to the terms of the Open Licence and subject to terms and conditions

BrandName.description: Brand Name that an organisation uses to market its products or services to a consumer
BrandName.title: BrandName

Branch.description: Information that locates and identifies a specific branch of a financial institution.
Branch.title: Branch

items.description: Information that locates and identifies a specific branch of a financial institution.

Identification.description: Unique and unambiguous identification of a branch of a financial institution.
Identification.title: Identification

SequenceNumber.description: Sequence Number that is used in conjunction with Identification to uniquely identify a branch. Physical branches should have 0 assigned, mobile and sub branches should have 1,2,3....etc. assigned.
SequenceNumber.title: SequenceNumber

Name.description: Name by which a branch is known and which is usually used to identify that branch.
Name.title: Name

Type.description: Codeset to indicate if a branch is physically in 1 location or is mobile
Type.title: Type

SortCode.description: United Kingdom (UK) Sort Code - identifies British financial institutions on the British national clearing systems. The sort code, which is a six-digit number, is usually formatted as three pairs of numbers, for example 12-34-56. It identifies both the bank and the branch(s) where the account is held.
SortCode.title: SortCode

CustomerSegment.description: The marketing segment which the branch is able to address in terms of customer type. Market segmentation is a marketing term referring to the aggregating of prospective buyers into groups, or segments, that have common needs and respond similarly to a marketing action. Market segmentation enables companies to target different categories of consumers who perceive the full value of certain products and services differently from one another
CustomerSegment.title: CustomerSegment

items.description: The marketing segment which the branch is able to address in terms of customer type. Market segmentation is a marketing term referring to the aggregating of prospective buyers into groups, or segments, that have common needs and respond similarly to a marketing action. Market segmentation enables companies to target different categories of consumers who perceive the full value of certain products and services differently from one another

Accessibility.description: Accessibility is the ability and ease a customer can access a service, good, associate, or facility. Features which make the Bank accessible to disabled people
Accessibility.title: Accessibility

items.description: Accessibility is the ability and ease a customer can access a service, good, associate, or facility. Features which make the Bank accessible to disabled people

Note.description: Summary description of services, facility and availability.
Note.title: Note

OtherCustomerSegment.description: Enter a new code , name and description for any other Customer Segment
OtherCustomerSegment.title: OtherCustomerSegment

items.description: Enter a new code , name and description for any other Customer Segment

Code.title: Code

Name.title: Name

Availability.description: Days and times defining when the branch is available for use by a customer
Availability.title: Availability

StandardAvailability.description: Standard hours of availability for the branch of the organisation
StandardAvailability.title: StandardAvailability

Name.description: Specifies the day of the week
Name.title: Name

Notes.description: Specify any note that is related the particular opening day e.g. Closed half day on Monday
Notes.title: Notes

OpeningHours.description: Opening & Closing Times of a branch of an organisation
OpeningHours.title: OpeningHours

items.description: Opening & Closing Times of a branch of an organisation

OpeningTime.description:
A particular point in the progression of time in a calendar day expressed in either UTC time format (hh:mm:ss.sssZ), local time with UTC offset format (hh:mm:ss.sss+/-hh:mm), or local time format (hh:mm:ss.sss). These representations are defined in "XML Schema Part 2: Datatypes Second Edition - W3C Recommendation 28 October 2004" which is aligned with ISO 8601.
Note on the time format:
1) beginning / end of calendar day
00:00:00 = the beginning of a calendar day
24:00:00 = the end of a calendar day
2) fractions of second in time format
Decimal fractions of seconds may be included. In this case, the involved parties shall agree on the maximum number of digits that are allowed.
OpeningTime.title: OpeningTime

ClosingTime.description:
A particular point in the progression of time in a calendar day expressed in either UTC time format (hh:mm:ss.sssZ), local time with UTC offset format (hh:mm:ss.sss+/-hh:mm), or local time format (hh:mm:ss.sss). These representations are defined in "XML Schema Part 2: Datatypes Second Edition - W3C Recommendation 28 October 2004" which is aligned with ISO 8601.
Note on the time format:
1) beginning / end of calendar day
00:00:00 = the beginning of a calendar day
24:00:00 = the end of a calendar day
2) fractions of second in time format
Decimal fractions of seconds may be included. In this case, the involved parties shall agree on the maximum number of digits that are allowed.
ClosingTime.title: ClosingTime

NonStandardAvailability.description: Non-standard hours of availability for a branch of an organisation
NonStandardAvailability.title: NonStandardAvailability

items.description: Non-standard hours of availability for a branch of an organisation

Name.description: Name provided for non-standard opening periods e.g. Christmas
Name.title: Name

StartDate.description: A particular point in the progression of time in a calendar year expressed in the YYYY-MM-DD format. This representation is defined in "XML Schema Part 2: Datatypes Second Edition - W3C Recommendation 28 October 2004" which is aligned with ISO 8601.
StartDate.title: StartDate

EndDate.description: A particular point in the progression of time in a calendar year expressed in the YYYY-MM-DD format. This representation is defined in "XML Schema Part 2: Datatypes Second Edition - W3C Recommendation 28 October 2004" which is aligned with ISO 8601.
EndDate.title: EndDate

Notes.description: Notes related to the Non-standard hours e.g. During shrimp season, the branch has extended opening hours
Notes.title: Notes

Name.title: Name

Notes.description: Specify any note that is related the particular opening day e.g. Closed half day on Monday
Notes.title: Notes

ContactInfo.description: Communication device number or electronic address used for communication.
ContactInfo.title: ContactInfo

items.description: Communication device number or electronic address used for communication.

ContactType.description: Contact type such Phone, Fax and email
ContactType.title: ContactType

ContactContent.description: Collection of information that identifies a phone/Fax number/ email, as defined by telecom services.
ContactContent.title: ContactContent

ContactDescription.description: Description of contact such as main phone number, alternate phone number, Fax number, alternate fax number, email and alternate email
ContactDescription.title: ContactDescription

OtherContactType.description: Other contact type which is not in the standard code list
OtherContactType.title: OtherContactType

Code.description: The four letter Mnemonic used whithin an XML file to identify a code
Code.title: Code

Name.description: Long name associated with the code
Name.title: Name

Description.title: Description

PostalAddress.description: Information that locates and identifies a specific address, as defined by postal services.
PostalAddress.title: PostalAddress

AddressLine.description: Information that locates and identifies a specific address, as defined by postal services, that is presented in free format text.
AddressLine.title: AddressLine

BuildingNumber.description: Name or Number that identifies the position of a building on a street.
BuildingNumber.title: BuildingNumber

StreetName.description: Name of a street or thoroughfare.
StreetName.title: StreetName

TownName.description: Name of a built-up area, with defined boundaries, and a local government.
TownName.title: TownName

CountrySubDivision.description: Identifies a subdivision of a country, for instance state, region, county.
CountrySubDivision.title: CountrySubDivision

Country.description: Nation with its own government, occupying a particular territory.
Country.title: Country

PostCode.description: Identifier consisting of a group of letters and/or numbers that is added to a postal address to assist the sorting of mail.
PostCode.title: PostCode

GeoLocation.description: Geographic location of the ATM specified by geographic coordinates or UTM coordinates.
GeoLocation.title: GeoLocation

GeographicCoordinates.description: Location on the earth specified by two numbers representing vertical and horizontal position.
GeographicCoordinates.title: GeographicCoordinates

Longitude.description:
Angular measurement of the distance of a location on the earth east or west of the Greenwich observatory.
The longitude is measured in decimal degrees.
Longitude.title: Longitude
